meanings.definition: (verb) past tense of frostbite: to injure or damage tissue by exposure to extreme cold
meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I accidentally frostbit my fingers while playing in the snow.
meanings.sent2: The hiker frostbit his toes when he forgot to wear warm socks in the icy mountains.
meanings.sent3: The snowman's nose looked like it had been frostbit by the chilly wind.
meanings.sent4: The icy wind seemed to frostbit the very air around us, making it hard to breathe.
meanings.sent5: The frostbit leaves crunched under our feet as we walked through the frozen forest.

meanings.definition: (adjective) affected by frostbite: having tissue damaged by exposure to extreme cold
meanings.sent1: Her frostbit fingers were numb and painful after being out in the blizzard.
meanings.sent2: The frostbit cheeks of the children turned rosy as they came in from the cold.
meanings.sent3: The frostbit popsicle looked like it had seen better days in the freezer.
meanings.sent4: The frostbit landscape was a stark reminder of the harsh winter conditions.
meanings.sent5: The frostbit skin on his face peeled and flaked as it healed from the cold exposure.
